title: customize Tag component (close icon)
body: ### What problem does this feature solve? So I have an items that previously have been picked by user, I render them as . also user can close this items (closable), in my case this is delete action. This delete action is sort of dangerous action, like it's gonna do some other changes related to this items. I'd like to show popconfirm before closing(deleting) this item, with some short message. I think this is also actual for select(tag mode). The end user experience is to show that is is not a simple action, and he has to be careful with this close action. ### What does the proposed API look like? My thoughts about api is to make some 'customCloseIcon' prop - Function(onClose):ReactNode ```javascript this.deleteDangerousItem(item.id)} customCloseIcon={(onClose) => ( {}} okText="Yes" cancelText="No" > )} > {item.name} ``` as far as I know it won't break api, it's still going to be animated and stuff like that

title: [Customized Form Controls] Add design convention: cloud have controlled property  `validator`.
Create vertical header mode for Table
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
The Table component does not support a vertical mode (explained here: [Stack Overflow)](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6368061/most-common-way-of-writing-a-html-table-with-vertical-headers). Occasionally, the number of rows that need to be displayed are few (<5), however there many columns (>20). Rather than display the table horizontally, which requires a great deal of horizontal scrolling, it is preferable to display the data vertically.

### What does the proposed API look like?
I think the `Table` component would benefit from the same API approach as the `Menu` component's `mode` property, which is vertical by default but can also be set to `horizontal`. By default, the `Table`'s `mode` should be `horizontal`, but it could also be set to `vertical`, which transposes the table.

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

title: TreeSelect: Different Selected Node format when select a node directly and select a node from search results
body:
### Version
3.1.4

### Environment
Windows 10, Google Chrome Version 63.0.3239.84 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/xr0m6j28ro](https://codesandbox.io/s/xr0m6j28ro)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Checked Node1 directly
2. Search for Node1, then checked Node1 from the search results

### What is expected?
Return data format should be the same

### What is actually happening?
1. Checked Node1 directly will return 
Object {node: Object, pos: "0-0", children: Array[1]}
▶node: Object
 pos: "0-0"
▶children: Array[1]

2. Search for Node1, then checked Node1 from the search results will return 
Object {key: "Node1", ref: null, props: Object, _owner: Object, _store: Object}
 key: "Node1"
 ref: null
▶props: Object
▶_owner: Object
 _store: Object

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

title: Callback/ Promise after form state update
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
There is a note on the page saying that `You shouldn't call setState manually, please use this.props.form.setFieldsValue to change value programmatically.`. The `setFieldsValue` works great, but would it be possible to add a callback/ promise functionality to this as we have this ins `setState`?

Sometimes I have to wrap some function in `setTimeout` with `0` to make sure that it gets executed after the form changes its state.

### What does the proposed API look like?
With a callback:

`form.setFieldsValue({ ...values }, callbackFn)`

With promises:

`form.setFieldsValue({ ...values }).then(() => { ...callback});`

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

### Version

Click on popover button; click inside input field; select any item from list; click on either "X" to remove selected item.

### What is expected?

Popover closes when selected item is removed by clicking on either "X".

title: Chrome在缩放模式下，Card组件的border被title的背景色覆盖
body:
### Version
3.1.4

### Environment
macos 10.12.4 ,MacBook Pro(13-inch)，chrome 版本 63.0.3239.132（正式版本）（64 位）

### Reproduction link
[https://ant.design/components/card-cn/](https://ant.design/components/card-cn/)

### Steps to reproduce
在chrome下将网站整体缩放70%，Card的上面border被背景色覆盖。效果如链接所示，https://p0.ipstatp.com/large/005a66f4c127009f2781

### What is expected?
Card的border不被背景色覆盖

### What is actually happening?
Card的border被背景色覆盖

---
chrome在缩放模式下，会产生小数像素，虽然ant-card的content-area的宽/高度和ant-card-head的margin-area的宽/高度的实际值相同，但实际渲染的效果ant-card-head的宽/高度比antd-card的宽/高度要大从而覆盖了其border，这个问题在safari和firefox的缩放模式下不存在。不确定这个问题是否只是在chrome的缩放模式下存在。

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

title: Form validate throws error when using on a disorder array
body:
### Version
3.1.3

### Environment
windows10 x64  Chrome/63.0.3239.84 

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/20jyp231lj](https://codesandbox.io/s/20jyp231lj)

### Steps to reproduce
Don't input, just click submit button.

### What is expected?
Don't throw errors.

### What is actually happening?
App crashed.

---
```
// createBaseForm.js #388-#395
errors.forEach((e) => {
  const fieldName = e.field;
  if (!has(errorsGroup, fieldName)) { // fieldName first time is field[1], and next time will be field[0], has() will return true.
     set(errorsGroup, fieldName, { errors: [] }); // set errorsGroup to { field: [ empty , {...} ] } first time.
  }
  const fieldErrors = get(errorsGroup, fieldName.concat('.errors')); // get field[0] returns undefined.
  fieldErrors.push(e); // throw error “Cannot read property 'push' of undefined”.
});
```

title: Incorrect TypeScript definition for Menu Component defaultProps
body:
### Version
3.1.0

### Environment
Chrome

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/o7lxqxy7xz](https://codesandbox.io/s/o7lxqxy7xz)

### Steps to reproduce
Version: 3.1.0

`Menu` Component's `defaultProps` is defined as:
```
static defaultProps: {
    theme: string;
    ...
};
```
But `MenuProps` interface is expecting:
```
theme?: 'light' | 'dark';
```


### What is expected?
No error

### What is actually happening?
This is causing TypeScript compiler to throw:
```
Error:(87, 25) TS2345: Argument of type 'typeof Menu' is not assignable to parameter of type 'string | ComponentClass<MenuProps> | StatelessComponent<MenuProps>'.
  Type 'typeof Menu' is not assignable to type 'StatelessComponent<MenuProps>'.
    Types of property 'defaultProps' are incompatible.
      Type '{ prefixCls: string; className: string; theme: string; }' is not assignable to type 'Partial<MenuProps>'.
        Types of property 'theme' are incompatible.
          Type 'string' is not assignable to type '"light" | "dark"'.
```

---
This can be corrected by changing `defaultProps` to:
```
static defaultProps: {
    theme: 'light' | 'dark';
    ...
};
```

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->

title: Expand all header
body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It feels natural to have an expand all button alongside with `onExpandAll` property, the same way it's done for selection column. It can be achieved using existing api, but UI would be much cleaner with header button.

 And perhaps it makes sense to group expandable options too. (see proposal api).

p.s. Thanks for the amazing product!

### What does the proposed API look like?
```
<Table
        ...
        rowExpansion={{
          expandedRowKeys: <...>,
          expandedRowRender: <...>,
         ...


          onExpandAll: <..>,
        }}
/>
```

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
